apidoc.description:
For every request, you have to provide a pre-shared key in the post body: {"psk":"XXXX"}
Requests without the pre-shared keys or with invalid pre-shared keys are automatically cancelled!

contents.title: Generate a token
contents.description:
Generates a one-time token for your application.
This token is valid for 120 seconds.

post.name: token-key
post.description: The token key you specified when starting the server

post.name: permission-level
post.description: The permission level for your application/device (from 1-4, see top right box)

contents.title: Register a device
contents.description: Registers a device on this server. This device is then allowed to send status updates and infos

get.name: token
get.description: A previously generated token (must not be older than 120 seconds)

get.name: type
get.description: Your device type (supported values: computer, laptop, tablet or mobile). You can use a custom device type too

get.name: native
get.description: If your app is connected through a native app ("true") or a web-app ("false")

contents.title: Unregister a device
contents.description:
Unregisters a device on this server. Use this endpoint only when you don't want your device to share information anymore.
Do not use this endpoint, if your device is offline

post.name: target-token
post.description: The device/application token you want to unregister

contents.title: Get registered devices
contents.description: Returns a list of all registered devices

post.name: target-token
post.description: (optional) Get information only for device with the given target-token

post.name: token-key
post.description: (optional) for the jarvis-web admin dashboard: when the token-key is set, you can bypass the GET token parameter because the web app doesn't have an application/device token

contents.title: Set a device property
contents.description: Sets a device property name and value. Recommended properties are notifications, location, battery, etc... value has to be a dictionary (default in get is {} )

get.name: token
get.description: The same token you used to register your device

post.name: property
post.description: The device property to set

post.name: value
post.description: The device property's value to set

contents.title: Get a device property
contents.description: Get a device property by name. If no token is set, get property from all devices

post.name: property
post.description: The device property to get

contents.title: Mark device as online
contents.description: Make sure to send a /hello request every 10-15 seconds. After 20s of inactivity, your device will be marked as offline.

contents.title: Check if device still exists
contents.description: Use this endpoint, after your application closed and gets reopened. This will check, if your token is still valid, or you'll need to generate a new one!

contents.title: Start a debugging session
contents.description: Starts a debugging session, use the /scan-debug endpoint to get new updates

contents.title: Scan for debugging updates
contents.description:
Returns all new updates since the last /scan-debug call.
You can call this endpoint quite frequently, as it doesn't touches the file system but stores data in RAM (every 0.5s is fine)

get.name: token
get.description: Your device token (the token you called /start-debug with)

contents.title: End a debugging session
contents.description: Ends your debugging session and clears all data

apidoc.description: The ID API is used to request real-time decisions from other services

contents.title: Ask for a decision
contents.description: Asks for an instant decision of "type" with a display name.

post.name: type
post.description: Decision type to make. This is a unique identifier

post.name: name
post.description: Display name of the decision to make

post.name: infos
post.description: String providing all informations to make this decision.

post.name: options
post.description: InstantDecision Options object

contents.title: Answer a request
contents.description: Answers an /id/ask request

post.name: target-token
post.description: Target device token

post.name: type
post.description: Decision type to make. This is a unique identifier

post.name: option
post.description: Index in the options object

post.name: description
post.description: (optional) String providing additional information for this decision.

contents.title: Scan for requests
contents.description:
Scan for requests.

If "token" is set, it only scans for requests from the given device token (use this to scan for answers).
If "type" is set, only return requests with the given type (use this to scan for ask requests).

post.name: target-token
post.description: (optional) Target device token

post.name: type
post.description: (optional) Scan for a given type

contents.title: Delete a decision
contents.description: Deletes a decision. Call this API endpoint either if the decision wasn't anwered on time or got answered and you don't need the decision storage anymore

post.name: target-token
post.description: Target device token

post.name: type
post.description: The type to delete

apidoc.description:
The MQTT Application API is being used for internal apps to request application ressources
You can use the Jarvis python package MQTT Client which wraps all the endpoints, or you send a MQTT request to these endpoints manually.

Every request has to contain the 'token' parameter in the post body. The Jarvis python package does this automatically!

contents.title: Register your application
contents.description: After calling this endpoint your application will have access to the Jarvis backend

post.name: token
post.description:
A token generated by your application (the Jarvis python package does this for you).
You can choose this token but it must start with 'app:' followed by 10+ hexadecimal characters

contents.title: Get devices
contents.description: Returns a list of all registered devices and applications

contents.title: Get a property
contents.description: Get a property from a given device/application or all devices/applications

post.name: key
post.description: key to get property from

post.name: target-token
post.description: (optional) token from device to get property from

contents.title: Set a property
contents.description: Set a device/application property

post.name: target-token
post.description: Token of the device/application to set/modify

post.name: key
post.description: Key to set/modify

post.name: value
post.description: Property to set

contents.title: Ask for a decision
contents.description: Ask for a specific decision. All devices and applications can answer

post.name: type
post.description: Decision type to make. This is a unique identifier

post.name: name
post.description: Display name of the decision to make

post.name: infos
post.description: String providing all informations to make this decision.

post.name: options
post.description: InstantDecision Options object

contents.title: Answer an ID request
contents.description: Answer an ID request from a device/application

post.name: target-token
post.description: Target device token

post.name: type
post.description: Decision type to make. This is a unique identifier

post.name: option
post.description: Index in the options object

post.name: description
post.description: (optional) String providing additional information for this decision.

contents.title: Scan for ID requests
contents.description: Scans for ID requests from a device/application

post.name: target-token
post.description: (optional) Target device token

post.name: type
post.description: (optional) Scan for a given type

contents.title: Deletes an ID request
contents.description: Deletes an ID request from a device/application

post.name: target-token
post.description: Target device token

post.name: type
post.description: The type to delete
